title: Wilsonville's DWFritz hiring dozens to meet manufacturing crunch
text: DWFritz expanded its Wilsonville headquarters a year ago, adding more than 30,000 square… more Cathy Cheney | Portland Business Journal Fast-growing DWFritz Automation Inc. in Wilsonville is looking for a big batch of manufacturing workers to fill a short-term need. The company said it wants to hire 60 mechanical and controls technicians as well as assemblers as it strives “to deliver complex automation systems to its clients in the consumer electronics business.” DWFritz expanded its Wilsonville headquarters a year ago, adding more than 30,000 square… more Cathy Cheney | Portland Business Journal These are three-month jobs, although some could grow into longer-term positions, the company said, depending on continued demand and employee performance. The company is looking to hire for day and swing shifts, beginning in March. “Our clients have high speed manufacturing demands and we are providing advanced solutions to support them by automating their inspection and assembly needs,” Frank Cannizzaro , vice president of operations at DWFritz, said in a statement. DWFritz has been in growth mode for several years, ramping up from 77 U.S. employees at the end of 2013 to 213 now. It has also added about 200 workers in China in that time. The company does all its design, engineering and assembly work in Wilsonville. Its workforce in China installs and supports the sophisticated tools the company makes. Last year, the company expanded its Wilsonville headquarters to make room for the growth. Pete Danko covers energy, manufacturing and ports. Business Pulse
